result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Mark W. Pearson was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Revoke dl 36 months plus 7 months   DOT to credit any administrative suspension and add any period of incarceration to revocation sentence.
IID for  36 month   On any vehicle owned or operated.
7 months county jail   DE shall serve 7 months in home detention/electronic monitor thru STOP program credit for 210 days time served
Absolute sobriety; Not to consume any alcohol; no entry upon premises of businesses that sell alcohol by the drink.  Complete any counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Must provide a DNA Sample.

OWI assessment within 72 hours and AODA assessment  within 45 days and follow-through with recommendations must attend victim impact panel obtain a driver assessment and maintain compliance with driver safety plan.
Fine/Costs $2500.00   Pay obligation within 30 days or apply to the Clerk of Court for a payment plan within 30 days and pay the $15.00 payment plan fee.
DNA Surcharge $250.00   Pay obligation within 30 days or apply to the Clerk of Court for a payment plan within 30 days and pay the $15.00 payment plan fee.

SPECIAL BOND Conditions with Random Testing
1. Defendant shall not consume any intoxicating beverages.
2. Defendant shall not enter the premises of any business that sells or serves alcoholic beverages by the drink.
EXCEPT that defendant may be on the premises of: 
for the purpose of employment, but only for the purpose of employment and only during his/her hours of employment.
3. Defendant shall be subject to RANDOM TESTING if his/her blood, breath or urine, and shall report to the Sawyer County Human Services Department at 10610 Main Street, Hayward, WI (ph. 715-638-3317) within 48 hours upon release from custody (not counting weekends and holidays) to schedule an intake session with the Sawyer County Traffic Offender Program (STOP) and to establish the procedures for the random testing. FAILURE TO REPORT TO STOP PROGRAM MAY RESULT IN THE ISSUANCE OF A WARRANT FOR THE DEFENDANT'S ARREST, MODIFICATION OF BAIL, POSSIBLE BAIL JUMPING CHARGES, AND/OR FORFEITURE OF BAIL.
